business.headline: India-UK free trade deal: How the deal could boost bilateral tradeThe deal is expected to provide greater market access for Indian products and services, while UK companies, particularly in sectors like automobiles and medical equipment, will also benefit from reduced tariffs.

Why some purchases are priceless: Startup founder on spending and living wellWe often treat money decisions like maths problems, but this startup founder says some buys, like a family car or your own home, bring wealth you can't count.

PM Modi in UK for FTA: Cheaper scotch and cars on cardsPrime Minister Narendra Modi is in the UK for a meeting with the UK Prime Minister and is also expected to meet King Charles III, with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) being the main focus. This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

Money matters, but joy matters more: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's mantra for lifeMany young earners feel constant pressure to save every rupee for the future. It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Whisky, chocolates, cars: What gets cheaper for Indians after UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Sensex ends 542 points lower, Nifty below 25,100 as volatility weighs heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 542.47 points lower at 82,184.17, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 157.80 points to close at 25,062.10. Selling pressure was visible across sectors, with FMCG, IT, and financial stocks dragging the indices down.

Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.
India-UK FTA: What's on the table in landmark $34 billion deal?For Indian businesses, the FTA opens up wider access to British markets by slashing tariffs and easing compliance.

No penalty for missed income tax deadlines? Panel suggests in New Tax BillThe suggestions come from the Select Committee, which has studied the new Income Tax Bill, 2025. This new Bill is meant to replace the old Income Tax Act of 1961.

ED conducts raids on properties linked to Anil Ambani in MumbaiThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday carried out searches at multiple locations in Mumbai connected to industrialist Anil Ambani's companies, days after the State Bank of India (SBI) classified Reliance Communications and Ambani himself as 'fraud'. While his personal residence wasn't searched, ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai targeted premises tied to Reliance Anil Ambani Group (RAAGA) companies in connection with an ongoing money laundering investigation.

IEX share price crashes 23% to hit 52-week low. What's behind the fall?IEX shares nosedived after CERC announced phased implementation of market coupling. The move aims to centralise price discovery, challenging IEX's dominance. Investors await clarity from the company's Q1FY26 results.

ED raids Anil Ambani-linked premises in Mumbai days after SBI's 'fraud' tagWhile Anil Ambani's personal residence was not part of the search operation, the ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai visited premises tied to some of his group companies.

NSDL IPO: Check key dates, issue size and other key detailsThe NSDL IPO will open on July 30 and close on August 1, offering 5.01 crore shares through an offer for sale by existing institutional shareholders.

Infosys shares down 1% despite good Q1 results. Should you buy, hold, or sell?Infosys posted a consolidated net profit of Rs 6,921 crore for the June quarter, up 8.7% compared to the same period last year. The revenue grew by 7.5% year-on-year to Rs 42,279 crore.

Investment advisor explains how 'free' stock tip groups scam peopleThe investment advisor explains how so-called "free" stock tip groups on WhatsApp and Telegram are duping thousands of unsuspecting retail investors, all under the guise of financial advice.
Sensex opens 44 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 122.46 points to 82,604.18, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 14.95 points to 25,204.95.

India-US trade deal still pending: Is Trump asking for too much?In the last few weeks, the US has signed several trade agreements with countries such as Vietnam, Indonesia, the Philippines and Japan. But a deal with India remains out of reach.

PM Modi UK visit: All you need to know about India-UK trade deal on the cardsThe free trade agreement will be India's first major bilateral trade deal with a developed country in over 10 years. It is also the most important trade deal the UK has signed since leaving the European Union.

Explained: Why buying flats on hefty EMIs may not be wiseAs returns from residential real estate continue to underwhelm, financial advisors are urging Indians to rethink the emotional appeal of homeownership and consider smarter, more flexible investment avenues for long-term wealth creation.

From aspiration to achievement: Paytm's operational discipline powers profitabilityThe new stock pricing implies that the Noida-based firm will be valued at 63-times of FY27-ended earnings. This revised valuation reflects the brokerage's positive view of Paytm's structural profitability journey, operating leverage, and robust performance in its core business segments.

Sensex up 540 points, Nifty tops 25,200; Tata Motors, Airtel gain over 2%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 539.83 points to 82,726.64 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 159 points higher at 25,219.90. Most of the broader market indices also gained during the trading session.

ED files Rs 1,654-crore case against Myntra over FDI violationsThe investigation comes at a time when e-commerce firms operating in India, particularly those backed by foreign investment, are facing increasing regulatory scrutiny for allegedly bypassing FDI rules through complex business arrangements.

Indiqube Spaces IPO: Should you invest? Check GMP and review by expertsIndiqube Spaces is aiming to raise Rs 700 crore through this IPO. The issue includes a fresh issue of 2.74 crore shares worth Rs 650 crore and an offer for sale of 21 lakh shares valued at Rs 50 crore.

Paytm posts Rs 123 crore profit in Q1: Is it a good time to buy the stock?Paytm's Q1 profit signals a turning point, but long-term sustainability hinges on regulatory clarity, competitive strength, and consistent execution across payments and lending. Investors must weigh promise against real-world pressure.
Deepinder Goyal adds Rs 2,000 crore as Eternal shares hit record highShares of Eternal jumped over 21% in the last 48 hours, hitting a new record high of Rs 311.60 on the NSE on Tuesday.
Sensex, Nifty open higher after US-Japan trade deal; Tata Motors leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 201.98 points to 82,388.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63 points to 25,123.90 as of 9:27 am.
Will US-Japan trade deal weigh in on Sensex, Nifty today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,181.50 as of 8:30 am, indicating that the Nifty 50 may open above Tuesday's close of 25,060.90.

IPO season heating up with Rs 2.58 lakh crore in queue: Is Dalal Street ready?After a steady first half, the second half of 2025 is expected to be packed with major public issues.  In July alone, 11 mainboard IPOs have either been listed or are set to launch.

CEO quits, HR head stays: Why Astronomer didn't fire Kristin Cabot over kiss cam rowAstronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned after a viral kiss cam video showed him and HR head Kristin Cabot cuddling at a Coldplay concert, sparking public backlash. While Cabot remains employed, legal experts say contractual obligations and internal investigations likely explain the delay in any action against her.

Paytm posts Rs 123 crore profit in Q1FY26, strengthens lead in merchant paymentsOperating revenue rises 28% YoY; contribution profit up 52% as AI-led efficiencies and financial services boost bottom line.

Who is Anish Shah, the CEO whose salary nearly doubled to Rs 47 crore?Anish Shah, Group CEO and managing director of the Mahindra Group, entered the list of top 5 paid auto CEOs for the first time. He received a 95% hike in pay, with his total earnings touching Rs 47.33 crore in FY25.

How a small AIS check can save you from a tax noticeIf you skip checking your AIS, you might end up missing some income details. This can lead to a mismatch between what you file and what the tax department already knows, and that can easily get you a notice later.

entertainment.headline: Blackpink's Lisa debuts on Netflix's Hitmakers, rejects rough tracksAfter much excitement, Lisa makes her Netflix debut on 'Hitmakers'. Twelve producers present original songs to her, but only one track wins her approval.

Singer Babla Mehta, know as Voice of Mukesh, dies in MumbaiSinger Babla Mehta, known as the Voice of Mukesh, died on July 22 in Mumbai. He also sang alongside legendary singer Late Lata Mangeskar in the film 'Chandni'.

Vicky Kaushal celebrates 10 years of Masaan: So much to learn, to growVicky Kaushal clocked 10 years of his iconic debut film 'Masaan' on Thursday. As the film turned a decade old, the actor reflected on his growth and learnings.

Mohit Suri honours Sandeep Vanga's fire and fearlessness as Saiyaara stirs heartsAs 'Saiyaara' soars to success, director Mohit Suri dedicates a special note to fellow filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga for supporting his film publicly even before its release.

Huma Qureshi's Bayaan to premiere at TIFF 2025 as only Indian filmActor Huma Qureshi's film 'Bayaan' will have its world premiere at TIFF 2025. The film directed by Bikas Ranjan Mishra has been selected for the prestigious global festival's Discovery section.

DJ Snake returns to India with a six-city tour: I've missed your energyDJ Snake is set to return to India with a six-city tour in September. He will kick off his tour in Kolkata on September 26 and wrap it up in Delhi-NCR on October 5.

No retakes, no scripts: The Traitors India director on filming show real-time'The Traitors India' director Nishant Nayak shared insights on directing the reality TV show with no retakes and live filming. India were wayward with the new ball and allowed both batters to settle down.  It's up to Jasprit Bumrah to help them get the first success.

WWE great Hulk Hogan dies at 71 due to cardiac arrestLegendary American wrestler Hulk Hogan died due to cardiac arrest, aged 71, on Thursday, WWE confirmed on Thursday. Hogan helped World Wrestling Entertainment catapult into mainstream popularity in the 1980s.

Ancient Hindu temple with Shivling and the Thailand-Cambodia warAncient Hindu temples are part of the area, the dispute over which has sparked a war between Thailand and Cambodia. The clashes began after Cambodian drones were reportedly spotted near the Ta Muen Temple Complex, a group of 11th-century Khmer Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. This is all about the 1,000-year-old Prasat Ta Muen Thom temple and how it turned into a Buddhist centre.

Rights group gives Muslim slant to India's fight against illegal immigrantsHuman Rights Watch (HRW) has accused India of "unlawfully expelling hundreds of Muslims" to Bangladesh. The report also claims some of them are Indian nationals. The HRW report gives a communal slant to a sovereign nation's action against illegal immigrants settled in its territory, who are a drain on resources and also a security risk.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna.
